titles.title: To honor the late playwright Arthur Miller and the University of Michigan for its intention of building a theatre in his name.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on 21st Century Competitiveness.
Mr. Ehlers moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 216.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/3/2005--Passed House amended. Recognizes Arthur Miller's extraordinary contributions to American literature and theater. Honors him as a great American and pioneer in the annals of American history. Commends the University of Michigan for its commitment to build the Arthur Miller Theatre, a fitting monument to one of its most distinguished alumni.
